author: joeyaiello
body: Haven't checked to see if this works yet, but I highly suspect that, given its dependency on CABs, that the updateable help system is completely broken.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
``` powershell
> Update-Help -Module Microsoft.PowerShell*                                     
Update-Help : Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
At line:1 char:1
+ Update-Help -Module Microsoft.PowerShell*
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Update-Help], NullReferenceException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.NullReferenceException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.UpdateHelpCommand

> $Error[0].Exception.StackTrace                                                                                        
   at System.Management.Automation.Help.UpdatableHelpSystem.SetDisablePromptToUpdateHelp()
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.UpdateHelpCommand.BeginProcessing()
   at System.Management.Automation.Cmdlet.DoBeginProcessing()
   at System.Management.Automation.CommandProcessorBase.DoBegin()
```

comments.author: HemantMahawar
comments.body: Short term alternative could be to ship available maml files in the package #1469

comments.author: Francisco-Gamino
comments.body: I am assigning this issue to me. I am working on a solution which is going to use zips on Linux. This means that the documentation team needs to upload to the download center a zip file in addition to the cab. On Windows, we will use both zip and cabs, and on Linux just zips. @adityapatwardhan is looking into adding the code to the publishing tools to generate the zip files.

comments.author: HemantMahawar
comments.body: @Francisco-Gamino Can you add milestone alpha.12 if this is going to ship in the next release?

title: Investigate updateable help on Linux (Update-Help)
